column5: My annual trip north has snuck up on me this year. I haven't been paying attention to weather at all and wondered if someone could give me a report. Has it been a wet/dry spring? What are water levels/temps like? Where is everyone finding the walleye? Thanks, and tight lines.
Check out this link for Canadian weather. Try the current conditions and forecast for SL. Good luck!http://www.weatheroffice.gc.ca/radar..._e.html?id=XDR

Lac Seul is lower then usual for this time of year. Gotta be close to 2' down from normal at this time of year. We're pretty much done running the falls from Pelican to Lac Seul, very low water. It's dry now in the bush, not much rain recently. This week is going to be sunny/warm. Summer is definitely here, walleye are on the main lake basin humps in 18-25' but also some fish relating to the weeds in 8-12'. Good luck on your trip.
